front.title: The Camellia-CMAC-96 and Camellia-CMAC-PRF-128 Algorithms and Its Use with IPsec

abstract.t: This memo specifies two new algorithms for IPsec. One is the usage of Cipher-based Message Authentication Code (CMAC) with the Camellia block cipher as an authentication mechanism in the IPsec Encapsulating Security Payload and Authentication Header protocols. This algorithm is called Camellia-CMAC-96. The other algorithm is a pseudo-random function (PRF) based on CMAC with the Camellia block cipher for the Internet Key Exchange, version 2. This algorithm is called Camellia-CMAC-PRF-128.
